author: sky.cactus
content: Please do not enable phone verification.  It goes against the ethos of a decentralized and pseudoanonymous system.

author: sky.cactus
content: It means we are crowding out any contributors who do not wish to be identified.

author: sky.cactus
content: It would be pretty easy to get around by just moving your ETH to another account.  However, it *would* at least make the operation non-free since you would at least have to pay for gas.

author: philcares
content: I am always a little bit disappointed by humanity when I see people trying to purposefully hurt others for their own good.

author: sky.cactus
content: <@!707707212184944702> It is not the common case, it is an outlier.  Its just that a single outlier can reach a lot of people in modern society.

author: sky.cactus
content: I have a sneaking suspicion that most of the scams on Ethereum are perpetrated by less than a dozen people.

author: sky.cactus
content: For example, while there are thousands (maybe tens of thousands) of fake tokens used to scam traders on Uniswap, they all follow a *very* regular pattern that suggests there is a single scammer running them all.

author: sky.cactus
content: In a server I sit in, for the longest time had a verification channel you had to click through.  It didn't seem to have any impact on the scammers, but there were a large number of noobs who were perpetually stuck in the verification channel.

https://altdentifier.com/  as a potential solution

author: sky.cactus
content: Best solution I have seen is to just have an active moderation staff.  Eventually the scammers stop wasting accounts on your server if they never get any bites because their messages are deleted too quickly.

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm philosophically against anything that requires any form of KYC, such as altdentifier.

author: sky.cactus
content: I would rather see a join fee than KYC.

author: sky.cactus
content: e.g., 0.001 ETH join fee or something.

author: nishant0
content: Yeah the obvious alternative is active moderation, but that can be time consuming. Also interestingly we get the scammers at exactly the same time they enter this server

author: sky.cactus
content: There are bots that will auto-ban anyone that is banned on any one of the servers that use the bot.  Essentially a shared blacklist.

author: sky.cactus
content: That can be useful in just increasing the cost of attacks since the scammers/spammers cannot reuse the same accounts across those servers.

author: sky.cactus
content: And there is a non-zero cost for creating Discord accounts (though it is pretty low).
